Dialogue.NPCText:
You nearly trip over a trail of scorched feathers, splattered crystal vials, and smoldering alchemical reagents before a frenetic, wild-eyed man spins to greet you.

His Transmuter’s Philtered Hat bristles with glass tubes. A Robe of Sublime Distillation sizzles faintly at the hem, and Gloves of Mercurial Peril are mottled with burns. This can only be Thendril Quillforge, Aerilon’s notorious experimental alchemist.

“Oho! Visitor! Mind the puddles, some still bite. Thendril Quillforge, at your service—assuming my next experiment doesn’t turn me into an eel before tea. What’s your business in my workshop of wonders?”

Option.text: Are you Thendril Quillforge, the alchemical visionary?
What exactly are you working on?
You seem... dangerous. Should I worry?
I’ve heard you supply Salia Moontide and Tolan Drift.
Do you have work for me?
You’re... clearly eccentric. What made you like this?
Just looking around.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril beams, nearly splashing a vial.

“Visionary? Yes! Some say madman, but I find the terms interchangeable.
I extract crystalline quintessence, bind it to alchemical reagents, and—BOOM!—sometimes invent new colors or burn holes through realities. Salia Moontide calls me ‘a liability with an apron,’ but who else can transmute etheric sludge into cloudsteel?”
He taps his Apron of Stubborn Stains proudly.

Option.text: What are you making for Salia and Tolan?
Do you need help with your work?
Isn’t that dangerous for Aerilon?
Good luck with the stains.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Currently? Crystal-dust infusions for Salia’s engines, sky-tinctures for Tolan’s airships, and... well, a little something for myself. Side effects include enlightenment, hallucinations, and the odd tendency to sing to clouds. Would you care to test a new batch? No? Sensible.”
He peers at you with both curiosity and disappointment.

Option.text: Do Salia and Tolan trust your work?
Do you ever assist the Conclave directly?
Do you need a courier?
I should leave before I start singing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril cackles, holding up a finger that sparkles with lingering mana.

“Of course you should worry! But no more than usual in Aerilon. The Azure Conclave keeps a close eye—especially Selara, after ‘the Quillforge Incident.’ But progress demands peril! Besides, my Boots of Crystalline Resonance are nearly explosion-proof... mostly.”
He grins, unrepentant.

Option.text: What happened in the Quillforge Incident?
Does Corvus Deyne use your reagents?
Sounds exciting! Do you have a job for me?
Best of luck... or protection.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril grows uncharacteristically somber.
“Let’s just say, Aerilon no longer allows feral potions in the baths. Salia nearly resigned. I apologized—eventually. But that’s the alchemical way: progress, penance, and perseverance!”
He perks up again, clearly having moved on.

Option.text: So Salia keeps you in check?
Do you ever help Corvus Deyne?
Do you need help with deliveries?
Enough about potions.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Salia Moontide? Pragmatic, brilliant, terrified of crystal resonance collapse—which is fair! She says my tinctures make her hair stand on end.
Tolan Drift is less cautious. He smuggles me rare dusts in exchange for ‘performance enhancers’ for his fleet. Between you and me, his skyships wouldn’t fly half so high without a little Quillforge alchemy.”
Thendril gives a theatrical wink.

Option.text: Do you also work for Corvus Deyne?
Do you need a courier for Salia or Tolan?
That’s... impressive.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril’s grin flickers, a note of caution entering his tone.
“Corvus Deyne? Dangerous man, that one. Too interested in my darker concoctions—stability be damned, as long as they explode. I supply what’s requested, but only what I can trust him not to use on Aerilon itself. Of course, he always wants more.”
He shrugs. “Some say I’m reckless. Corvus? He’s careful—but only about power.”

Option.text: Would you work for him against Selara?
Do you need help with deliveries?
I’ll stay clear of Conclave politics.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Selara Vael is the mind that keeps this city aloft, but Corvus wants to make it a fortress. Me? I want Aerilon to sing—literally, if I can get the crystals right.
I serve the Conclave as best I can, even if they don’t always appreciate my methods. But today, it’s not the council that needs you. It’s me, Thendril Quillforge, and my next impossible errand.”

Option.text: What’s this errand?
Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril scurries to a bubbling cauldron and retrieves a sealed, swirling vial. Blue mist coils inside, and the glass is etched with intricate runes.

“I need this delivered to a most... peculiar scholar outside Aerilon—a ‘Shade Scholar,’ so the rumors say. Only those who study shadow can stabilize my newest infusion.
The Vial of Refracted Dusk is essential: if it works, Salia can stabilize the levitation engines for another decade. If not—well, let’s not dwell on that.
I can’t leave the city, and Salia is much too careful. Will you brave the risks, shadows, and rival interests to deliver this safely? I’ll see to it you’re remembered among Aerilon’s friends.”

Option.text: I will deliver the Vial of Refracted Dusk for you.
Why does it require a Shade Scholar?
Who else might want this vial?
Are you sure it’s safe to carry?
This sounds risky. I need to think.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril presses the shimmering vial into your hand, careful not to spill a single mote.
“Remember: Only a true Shade Scholar can accept and complete this delivery—anyone else, and the infusion might unweave itself or summon… well, don’t ask. Seek out the Scholar, deliver the vial, and Aerilon will owe you a debt.
I’ll be waiting (hopefully in the same number of limbs). Good luck!”

Option.text: You can count on me, Thendril.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril’s eyes gleam with mad conviction.
“Ah! The Vial’s infusion must be exposed to darkness both literal and learned. Only those who’ve gazed into the Abyss of Dusk—the so-called ‘Shade Scholars’—possess the knowledge and subtlety to keep it from collapsing or going, as Salia says, ‘spectacularly awry.’
In the wrong hands? Clouds of nightmares. In the right? Stabilized flight for all Aerilon.”

Option.text: Then I must find a true Shade Scholar.
Too dangerous for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril glances over his shoulder, lowering his voice.
“Corvus Deyne would pay handsomely for a sample—don’t let him tempt you. Minax’s agents want any edge to drop us from the sky, and even Wind’s magi covet my formulas.
But only the Shade Scholars truly understand shadow’s stabilizing paradox. Trust no one else! If intercepted, hurl the vial into moonlight and run.”
He grins. “Or fly, if you’re lucky.”

Option.text: Understood. I’ll deliver it with care.
Perhaps another errand, someday.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril looks thoughtful.
“Safe? Hah! Let’s say the Vial of Refracted Dusk is—ah—‘predictable’ if kept in shadow, sealed, and away from excessive humming. If you notice your reflection lagging behind, don’t worry; it’ll catch up eventually.
I’ll grant you a small sigil for protection—press it if things grow weird.”

Option.text: Alright, I’ll take the vial (and the sigil!).
This is too strange for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril shrugs, splashing another reagent into a bubbling flask.
“No shame in caution! If you change your mind, look for smoke signals or the scent of burnt ozone. That’ll be me. Aerilon always needs new friends—and I always need new test subjects!”

Option.text: Perhaps another time.
On second thought, I’d like to help.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril blinks, then bursts into laughter. “Oh, where to begin? Childhood, trauma, or the day I invented the smell of fear?”

He leans in conspiratorially.
“I wasn’t always this way. Once, I was an apprentice in Wind. Dutiful. Clean. Boring. But then... it happened.”
“Would you like to hear the tale of my first alchemical awakening? Or the time I almost invented a new element—on accident?”

Option.text: Tell me about your first explosion.
What happened with your mentors in Wind?
Have you always been obsessed with shadow and crystals?
Actually, no thanks.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Ah yes… the ‘Kettle Cataclysm’.”

“I was ten. I thought—just for fun—that my mother’s teapot might distill mushroom spores more evenly. Long story short: I leveled our greenhouse, turned our cat into a musical instrument, and invented an entirely new cheese—by accident.”

“It was… glorious.”

You feel a strange tingle of inspiration just hearing the story.

Option.text: That explains so much...
...you turned the cat into what now?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A lute. A sentient one. It sang in E minor and screamed when plucked improperly. We called it Whiskersong. The council confiscated it.”

You’re not sure if he's joking.

Option.text: I... need a drink.
You’re utterly insane. Tell me more.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril’s grin tightens.
“Wind doesn’t appreciate creativity. My mentor—Archchemist Diren Ghaast—preferred ‘precise replication over spontaneous revelation.’ He said I was unstable.”

“I said he lacked imagination. So I proved him wrong with a self-writing scroll that insulted him in 17 dialects. I was exiled the next morning.”
“Best thing that ever happened to me.”

Option.text: I’d have exiled you too. Impressive scroll though.
I’ve heard Wind punishes creativity.
What drove your obsession with crystals and shadow?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril narrows his eyes.
“A mage of experience, I see. Then you understand—Wind may have knowledge, but they fear transcendence. Fear what magic becomes when you let go of control.”

“I prefer chaos as a teacher. Brutal, unpredictable, but honest.”

Option.text: Chaos is... honest? I’ll remember that.
So tell me about this obsession you have.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril leans close, voice low.
“Have you ever stared into raw Azure Crystal under moonlight? Watched it pulse? It hums in colors we don’t have names for. I once saw a hue that unwound time in my peripheral vision.”

“I’ve been trying to recreate that moment ever since. Every concoction, every failure—it’s a breadcrumb back to that impossible color.”

He sighs dreamily.
“One day, I’ll bottle it. Or implode trying.”

Option.text: That’s beautiful. Dangerous, but beautiful.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel inspired by Thendril’s madness.

Option.text: You should probably never be left unsupervised.
Do you have any samples to test?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thendril’s eyes widen. “You? Brave enough to test ‘Vial #42-Aleph’? I like you already.”
He slaps a small, warm vial into your hand.
“It might boost your insight. Or cause your hair to levitate. Probably both. Good luck!”

You feel... oddly sharper. And lighter.

Option.text: Thanks... I think?
My eyebrows feel funny...
Let’s get back to serious work.
